message:
Question guys how can FB know that I know someone and suggest him to me. 
who is in another country, never met in person, never been in the same geographical location together, no mutule friends, our only correspondence is through the my company's mail and Lync servers.
Is having the same company name as place of work given that they are not exact, enough? 
Please share your thoughts

Edit: I log to FB from inside the company vpn network can that be something used for linking us?

data.message: I think >> It's Discrete Mathematics. You can do a lot of things if you put your data in a graph structure.

I've had the same question for sometime now, FB keeps suggesting people who have absolutely nothing that links them to me except a phone book entry may be. then it occurred to me, they are probably using the FB mobile app which has mostly used their phone contacts to figure out the connection. I cannot see it any other way.
don't have him as contact on my phone either that would be too easy
If you communicate on any public mailing groups like Google groups, it could be, it happened to me before
adding to your questions , if you searched google for some products , you will find Facebook ads related to it, how come ?

ممكن بنفس الطريقة اللي كل الشركات الكبيرة بتشارك بيها معلومات الإعلانات
http://www.aboutads.info/choices/

دي مقالة بتشرح الموضوع أكتر
http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/columnist/komando/2015/10/09/stop-facebook-targeted-ads-and-tracking/73588820/
i think it is due to the vpn since if any one register over facebook through your network you can find him on the suggestion
His mobile number in your contacts ?!
